text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires describing at least three enforcement mechanisms, such as fines, injunctions, and director liability. The candidate answer explicitly lists and details several enforcement tools in Section 2, including: 1. Financial Penalties (fines), 2. Civil/Administrative Liability (private right of action, which functions similarly to an injunction or liability mechanism), 3. Random Audits & Data Verification, 4. Public Shaming, 5. Linkage to Government Contracts, 6. Incentive-Based Approaches, and 7. Whistle-blower Protections & Rewards. This clearly exceeds the requirement of three mechanisms.", "criterion_id": "12b6750b-2ee2-4775-ab21-303102470faf"}
